Issue reports and contributions are very welcome.', 'With the approval of ', ' and ', ', the Python community shifted
towards a strong focus on standardisation for packaging software, which allows
more freedom when choosing tools during development and make sure packages
created using different technologies can interoperate without the need for
custom installation procedures.', 'This shift became even more clear when ', ' was also approved, as a
standardised way of specifying project metadata and dependencies.', ' was born in this context, with the mission of validating
', ' files, and make sure they are compliant with the standards
and PEPs. Behind the scenes, ', ' relies on ', '
files, which, in turn, are also a standardised way of checking if a given data
structure complies with a certain specification.', 'The easiest way of using ', ' is via CLI.
To get started, you need to install the package, which can be easily done
using ', ':', 'Now you can use ', ' as a command line tool:', 'You can also use ', ' in your Python scripts or projects:', "To do so, don't forget to add it to your ", ' or specify it as a

', ' and ', ' are used to validate aspects of ', '.', 'If you are only interested in using the Python API and wants to keep the
dependencies minimal, you can also install ', '
(without the ', ' extra dependencies group).', "If you don't install ", ', ', ' will
try to download a list of valid classifiers directly from PyPI
(to prevent that, set the environment variable
', ' or ', ').', 'On the other hand, if ', ' cannot find a copy of
', ' in your environment, the validation will fail.', 'More details about ', ' and its Python API can be found in

instructions for using it in a ', ' and information about
extending the validation with your own ', '.', 'Tip', 'If you consider contributing to this project, have a look on our

file at the root of the project repository.
You can customize that by defining a ', ' using
the ', ' parameter.', 'You can also use ', ' to update to the latest stable
version of ', ' (recommended).', 'This project and its sister project ', ' were initially created in the
context of PyScaffold, with the purpose of helping migrating existing projects
to ', '-style configuration when it is made available on ', '.
